intro: Lapeirousia hantamensis, commonly known as the Hantam daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces narrow, grass-like leaves and blooms during the summer months. Lapeirousia hantamensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is valued for its ability to thrive in dry conditions.
